summary:
"As an artist, my main interest is to create artworks that evoke emotions in people and allow them to see the world in a different way. I am passionate about experimenting with different textile techniques and materials to find new forms of expression. Additionally, I am interested in promoting sustainability and circular economy in the fashion and art industry, and I have founded my own company for that purpose. I am committed to promoting the culture and art of my country, and I have had the honor of exhibiting my works in important galleries and museums in America, Europe, and Asia."

-
Juliana Garcia Bello (1989) is a native of Tierra del Fuego, a province in southern Argentina. She received her degree in Clothes & Fiber Design from the University of Buenos Aires (UBA), where she was awarded a diploma of honors for her outstanding performance. Her final university project was selected by the Instituto Nacional de Tecnología Industrial Argentina for the catwalk at the Buenos Aires Fashion Week.

In 2019, she founded Garcia Bello, a company based on upcycling techniques and circular economy. She was a winner of several awards, including the Autores de Moda BA BAFWEEK in Argentina, the Fashion Makes Sense Award 2019 in the Netherlands and Woman Collection Redress Design Award 2020 in Hong Kong.

Juliana has studied jewelry at Taller Eloi with Jimena Rios and has attended seminars and workshops with renowned artists, including Margarita Maldonado, Francisca Kweitel, Pilar Cotter, Teresa Estapé, Margarita Garcia Faure, Rodrigo Acosta, and Julia Sbriller.

Her artworks have been exhibited in galleries and museums worldwide. Notable exhibitions include Museo Latinoamericano de Buenos Aires MALBA, Museo de Arte Decorativo de Buenos Aires, Fondo Nacional de las Artes, Victoria and Albert Museum V&A, Museum Arnhem and The International Fashion Showcase London.

profile_positions.description:
GARCIA BELLO is a fashion brand that values upcycling and sustainability. Each piece is carefully handmade with a timeless design that embodies the spirit of the Argentinian Patagonia. The brand gives new life to pre-existing materials and objects, creating unique and meaningful garments that tell their own stories. The collection is simple, practical, and suitable for everyday wear, reflecting the idea of a home as both a shelter and a connection to the land. Currently, the brand is based in The Netherlands.

www.garciabello.nl
info@garciabello.nl
profile_positions.title: Founder and Creative Director

profile_positions.description:
Creadores de Imágenes" is a program dedicated to the production and development of creative projects in Latin America and beyond, catering to Spanish-speaking audiences. It provides a space for artists to connect, exchange ideas, and engage in dialogue. The program is designed to facilitate research and experimentation with photography as a medium of expression.

creadoresdeimagenes.com
profile_positions.title: Group Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
𝑁𝑜𝑡 𝐽𝑢𝑠𝑡 𝑎 𝐿𝑖𝑏𝑟𝑎𝑟𝑦 is an art zine library (based in P-OST Arnhem), but it is not only a library. It is a space for gathering, showcasing artistic and experimental manners of publishing practices and printed matters. 

instagram: @not.just.a.collective / @notjustafair

profile_positions.title: Program: Not Just a Library

profile_positions.description:
Subjects:
- Clothes Design: Learn principles and techniques used in creating clothing, including garment construction, pattern-making, and sewing techniques, as well as cultural and historical contexts in contemporary fashion design.
- Production Design Process of Clothes and Textiles: Practical course on designing and producing clothing and textiles, including materials selection, pattern-making, cutting, sewing, quality control, cost analysis, and sustainability considerations.
- Expressive Modes of Visual Language: Explore ways of conveying meaning and emotion through visual language, including drawing, painting, photography, and digital art, and learn techniques for creating impactful visual works.
- Design and Social Responsibility: Examine the role of design in promoting social responsibility and sustainability, including ethical considerations related to labor rights, environmental impact, and cultural appropriation. Learn strategies for designing products and services that address social and environmental challenges.
profile_positions.title: Professor

profile_positions.location: Buenos Aires, Ciudad autónoma de Buenos Aires, Argentina
profile_positions.description:
Subject: 
HD4 / "Making Design" is a fundamental subject in all branches of design, as it focuses on developing practical skills for the materialization of creative ideas. Through this subject, students will learn to use tools and techniques for the design and production of objects, products, graphics, spaces, and/or services, applying principles of ergonomics, aesthetics, functionality, and sustainability. In addition, teamwork, experimentation, and innovation in the creative process will be encouraged.
profile_positions.title: Adjunct Associate Professor

profile_positions.location: Buenos Aires, Ciudad autónoma de Buenos Aires, Argentina
profile_positions.description:
— Clothes Design I, Cátedra Saltzman

In the "Diseño de Indumentaria" course, students will learn how to create and bring their ideas to life through various activities, such as creating mockups, developing mood boards, and working with textiles. Taught by experienced faculty members, the course emphasizes creative concept design and teamwork, with regular classroom assessments to provide feedback and refine skills. Students will also have opportunities to showcase their work in fashion shows, preparing them for a successful career in the fashion industry.
profile_positions.title: Professor

profile_positions.description:
— Clothes Design I, Cátedra Fiorini

"Diseño de Indumentaria" is an exciting course that encompasses a wide range of skills and experiences for students. Throughout the course, students will engage in various activities, including presentations, textile art, data sheets, and industrial sewing, among others. With a focus on design, students will learn to create innovative and unique garments that meet the demands of the fashion industry. The course also provides opportunities for student activities and fashion shows, allowing students to develop skills and gain valuable experience in the field. By the end of the course, students will be equipped with the knowledge and skills necessary to succeed in the fashion design industry.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor
